Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Parky0209
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room for 3 nights and had an excellent stay in Rome. The rooms are basic with some of the essential facilities including a safe and hair dryer. Could have done with coffee making facilities but with the many cafes/bars within easy reach it really wasn't a problem. The shower was excellent...just what was needed after a day pounding the streets! Cleanliness was spot on...our room was cleaned every day, beds made & fresh towels. Contrary to their appearance the beds were very comfy! Breakfast was average...very little choice, and coffee from a machine was poor...again not so much of an issue with the facilities available in the locality. Locality was good, a 20 minute walk to the key sites and close to the metro. Cleaning staff and receptionist on arrival were really pleasant and helpful. The free map from reception was invaluable. However, breakfast staff were unhelpful, they didn't greet us in the morning and just stood and watched whilst we struggled with the coffee machine. Finally, the gentleman on reception as we checked out put a dampener on what was otherwise a great stay - we were unaware of the 2€ per night city tax (not in the guide books or advised by travel agent) - whilst we were happy to pay the 12€ he was incredibly grumpy about the fact that we didnt have the correct change and made no effort to find any making us feel quite uncomfortable. Overall, this hotel does exactly as it says on the tin, it's great value for money and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: jonboysxi
Reviews.Content: real good location,cheap and cheerfull stay had no complaints was clean and tidy and good location to get around,metro just a few mins walk down the street,would use again

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable lodging at the right price”
Reviews.Author: tomcat408
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louisiana is an older hotel on the 4th floor of an older building. The room was typically European small but clean. The lift is small which required multiple trips to get our luggage up, a minor inconvenience. The staff is helpful, if not entirely engaging. The breakfast is the usual Italian breakfast fare--breads, fruits, coffee, etc. It is a reasonable walk to the city bus route, the hop on hop off bus and La Repubblica Metro. Our main complaint was the noise from the street below. There is a ristorante located nearby and the rowdy crowd kept going until the wee hours. Nothing memorable but it is clean and the price is very reasonable. For a short (2-3 day) stay it is fine, wouldn't want to stay for an extended visit.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nini082
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I spent 4 days at this Hotel and we really enjoyed! Nice location, good breakfast. Rooms are clean but a little bit dark. Nice staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: dee_ry_2009
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, within walking distance of most of the main sites. Breakfast was a little bit disappointing but it did fill us up. We are happy with our choice and we feel we did get our moneys worth. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: laikatos
Reviews.Content: We where met by a room that felt like a sauna of air freshener, and a receptionist that had no idea of how to turn off the central heating..."it turns off automatically at 23.00"...a bit late for a good night sleep when you are not able to open the window in 1.floor directly facing the street!! I guess they used the air freshener to cover up the fact that all their rooms where smoking rooms, which was not mentioned in our booking site. To be honest the hotel did not really pick up after that! It is a 1 star hotel, and do not expect anything else! If you are in the habit of enjoying hot showers I hardly recommend to be out of bed before 8 in the morning, or you have to wait until 14.00. And the happily we spotted the bloodstains on our bed cover the first night. They say they have wireless internet connection, but that does not work!! As mentioned, not a hotel worth visiting, you can find better hotels in the same street for almost the same price!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, convenient location to train station, decent walk to tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: kcrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Louisiana for three nights over the weekend in Rome. It was a decent part of town and a convenient location to walk from the train (less than a kilometer). The reception desk was upstairs, which is strange and not perfectly labelled, but there is an elevator to haul luggage up. The hotel staff was adequately helpful, though I wouldn't give them any service awards. The room was clean enough, though the furniture was cheap and seemed easily breakable. There were scuff marks on the walls, which could be easily spruced up with some paint. The bathroom was big enough, though the shower head was old and leaky and the accordion doors didn't want to stay closed. The water temperature fluctuated quite a bit and the shower stall was quite small...smaller than other European hotels we've stayed. There was wifi available in the common area only, and was a little finicky to connect, but usually did so after some waiting. There was an outdoor area in the center of the building which was nice for sitting and relaxing in the evening and checking email, but smokers and mosquitos did hinder our enjoyment. The included breakfast was pretty light compared to other hotels, but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sonecika
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite central, situated about 5 min from the subway line station. Even if we were shoched when we first saw the building (I checked the adress to be sure), the interior wasn't that bad. The building holds more hotels, our reception was at fist flour and our room at 4th flour. The floor and the rooms were renovated and looked nice and clean, bath was large enough. What I disliked was the fact that the wireless was working only at the first flour, but even if I managed to get a poor connection, at this floor I didn't have network for the telephone! So in fact I did not have any wireless working! Another bad thing was the breakfast - very poor and only sweet, cold things - cold croissants, jam, honey, butter, cereals with cold milk, bad cofee and juice- I hated it from the first day and hated it more every day. It would be nice to have more diversity and not only sweet things! The staff was ok, some more kind than others. Overall, it's a good hotel for a limited budget, cause Rome is quite an expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: cactie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights there. The hotel is a little bit far from the public transport. You have to walk 15 minutes to the nearst metro station (Plazza Republica or Termini). Our room is on the 1st floor. It's clear and not to small. But the bathroom is tiny :-(. You can only take a shower with very hot or very cold water. The staff is friendly. There are some restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Madvgr
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a nice surprise. Great location near Termini station and close to most of old town attractions. Clean, spacey and quiet rooms and nice breakfast (not to many choices but you can eat as much as you want).

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Seniortraveller09
Reviews.Content: Somewhat strange setup - there are 5 hotels in the building, and the reception for Hotel Lousiana is on the first floor. Initial impression was not favourable due to very dirty carpet at entrance, but our room, on the 4th floor, was clean, quiet, and for Rome, spacious. Staff pleasant and helpful. Breakfast OK, once I'd mastered the coffee machine, with plenty of rolls and various types of croissants. 10 mintues walk from Termini station and we walked easily to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi fountain and Barberini Palace. We enjoyed several meals at the nearby trattorias on Via Castelfidardo and Via R Cadonna. We did try the Henry Cow opposite on the first night because it is so close, but wouldn't really recommend it and were irritated by the number of hawkers interrupting our meal. One tiny criticism - the bulb in one of the bedside lamps didn't work, and although frequently mentioned, it was never replaced. Overall however, the hotel was very good value, and a good base for a sightseeing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: cam60
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 5th floor which has been refurbished . The room was a good size and very clean ,the en suite was spacious . the hotel was within walking distance of the main sights . the room was always nice and cool with the air conditioning . A good no frills base to use for seeing Rome

Reviews.Title: “Beware this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellatuscany
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to warn anyone who is thinking about staying at this hotel. Clearly when our travel agent made the booking she had no idea how appalling & dirty the rooms were. To start with the lift (yes just the one) was tiny, slow & ricketty & often went past the floor you wanted it to stop on. With 4 of us & double the amount of luggage it took forever & was quicker to lug some of it up the stairs. The rooms were dingy, smelly, the walls were dirty, the shower curtain was all ripped & the bathroom ceiling was covered in mould (just look at the photo). To top it all off the air conditioning was on high but let out warm air which was horrific in mid June. If you look at the website the rooms look simple but clean & I cannot believe how they can get away with such false advertising. I don't blame our travel agent as she obviously went by what she saw on the website. If you stay in Rome please take my advise & do not stay at this hotel. I would be interested to hear other people's experiences of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “very unfriendly management”
Reviews.Author: loving_traveller
Reviews.Content: First the good news: the hotel is fairly clean, but their organisation and how they treat guests is just awful! We had a reservation, I confirmed it the day before we arrived and when we arrived at 11 p.m. they told us that both of our rooms were not available. They booked a different hotel for us and paid for it and for the taxi to and from, but they never we willing to listen to our complains. Especially the manager is very unfriendly, ready to give you false information all day long. I would never recommend that hotel unless you do not want any "feeling welcome". The two points just because the rooms were okay.

Reviews.Title: “great stay thanks!”
Reviews.Author: helloss
Reviews.Content: there is one unofficial website of the lousianna that almost made me not book it, but the official website shows pictures that are updated. the room was ,clean ,nice colours, modern, lift, nice clean hall, breakfast , great restaurants right on the street and security. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vicky76
Reviews.Content: I thought this Hotel was perfectly pleasant. It isn't a hotel for a luxury weekend away, but does the job cleanly and pleasantly if you are going to be out and about seeing the sites all day/evening. The breakfast wasn't great, but I was forewarned so not disappointed (do not drink the coffee from the machine, it doesn't even taste like coffee). There are plenty of better places to have breakfast nearby anyway. It is quite a way from most of the sites (20 minute + walk) so it may be better to use the metro or taxi, but all in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, no problem!”
Reviews.Author: jmp2151
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides good, solid, clean rooms and great service. The ground floor foyer and creepy elevator might confuse you, but once you make it upstairs you are met with a pleasant and efficient hotel. Although not overly spacious, we were very comfortable in our room with clean sheets, TV, wardrobe spce, and fresh towels and bathroom toiletries daily. Our bathroom was quite small and the door was a little rickety, but neither of those things bothered us at all; indeed the bathroom was sparkling clean! The breakfast room was very cute, and provided pastries, cereal, juices and coffee daily. Aesthetically speaking, the hotel itself and decor are nothing special at all, but we had a safe, pleasant and worry-free stay here; I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopa
Reviews.Content: Its even quite good! The entrance and the reception are very modest - just a staircase with a strange elivator.The rooms are more than fine; bit small but very clean, fresh towels,flat tv(even a channel in english-very rare in italy),radio and cooling AC. breakfast was fine, horrible coffee but fresh buns- what we expected. the location is not bad- not too close to termini station and about 15 min walking from barberini and the center of rome with buses and metro near by. Over all would stay there again! (dont get confused with hotel monaco in the same reception but a floor lower-much older and dark rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Exceeds expectations for a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: scousebadger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Louisana, 84 Via Flavia, Rome from Friday 2nd for three nights. The hotel is located in the Termini area of Romes' city centre only a few hundred yards from the Termini station itself. I have to say that we were a little worried as just after we had booked the hotel, I came across this website and there were 2 reviews about Hotel Louisiana. One was quite good and one quite bad! we need not have worried as we thought it was great. The entrance of the hotel is literally just an entrance with nothing but the doorway stairs and a lift. The Building actually houses a number of hotels so it is a communal entrance and the reception for Hotel Louisiana is up the stairs on the first floor. When we arrived in Rome late in the morning we were too early for check in so we found the hotel and left our luggage there and went to explore a little. The rooms are quite small with a couple of feet either side of the bed but more than adequate. we had enough wardrobe space. The bathroom had a toilet, bidet, shower and sink but no bath and wasnt too pokey. The room and bathroom were both very clean and nicley decorated. The towels in the bathroom were all replaced with fresh ones everyday, even those which had been hung up to be reused. There was a hairdryer and shaving point in there also. There was an easy to use control point to adjust the heating and air conditioning levels. There was also a digital radio system and a flat screen TV which both worked fine. Breakfast was dissapointing but to be honest a continental breakfast even in the ritz would have been too. They just arn't enough for me. A Continental breakfast traditionally is bread, rolls or croissants and butter and perhaps jam, coffee and tea. Anywhere that offers anything else like cereals, ham and cheese etc then simply isnt a continental breakfast, they perhaps add those because Brits and Americans usually have more substantial breakfasts. The croissants and rolls were fresh but the for drinks there is a machine which are best avoided like the plague if you like quality tea or coffee. The Termini area is supposidley the 'worst' area to stay in the centre of Rome and thus why it is the cheapest. I never at any time felt threatened or unsafe. We had a wonderful time at this hotel, the staff were polite and very helpful and we would definatley go back!

Reviews.Title: “Small but impeccable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the set up which is a bit strange (only a plaque on the wall, you need to go up a dark staircase to find reception on first floor) I found the hotel to be impeccably clean and the staff friendly and very polite. The rooms are small but immaculate and the breakfast is in a small room on a do it yourself basis (coffee + drinks machine) fresh bread rolls and (not very nice) croissants: you can have as much as you want. I would definitely stay there again. it is very conveniently situated with plenty of restaurants in the same street.

HotelInfo.Name: Louisiana
HotelInfo.Address: Via Flavia 84, 00187 Rome, Italy
